item.title: 8 Steps to a Better Console Application
item.description: The console application is the workhorse of the software world. It isn't flashy like its graphical cousins the desktop and web app. It isn't sought after like the mobile app. Graphical user interfaces compose images, sophisticated widgets, and animations, but the humble command-line interface (CLI) has none of that. It runs in shells with strange names like Bourne-Again Shell (Bash), Korn Shell, and CMD.EXE. Its tools are simple lines of text printed to a terminal or redirected to a file.
